Articles.Content:
Hello,

In this thread you can read about my Jool 5 mission as you could probably guess due to the title . It will be an attemt for level 3. I will warn you, I have included a lot of screenshots in imgur albums, due to time restrictions I only included discriptions on the most important ones (you can always PM me if I missed an important pic). Furthermore I advise you to listen to this song:

(over and over and over ) as seeing the craft made me think about it, hence the name of the Mothership. Anyways, let's start with the mission.

First off, i'll answer these questions:

- Which game versions did you use?

1.04

- What mods did you use, if any?

Kerbal Alarm Clock, to easily find the transfer windows

- How many Kerbals are on the mission?

5, 1 for every moon (aka level 3)

- How many launches was needed to start your mission from Kerbal?

10: 1 main launch

7 refuel launches (could have been less with a better pc)

1 extra fuel modules

1 to bring crew and an extra reentry pod

- Did you needed a refueling mission?

unfortunately yes, I did the whole mission without, but could not get the mothership in orbit around Kerbin anymore so I had to reload and send a refuel mission.

- Did you bring a Living Quarter (Hitch-hiker's Storage) for the guys during the long journey?

there was 1 space plane passenger part for 4 kerbals, the last one sat in the command pod

- Did you bring additional stuff like satellites, rovers, etc?

does a SSTO for Laythe count? if so, yes.

- Share the delta-V informations too, if you tracked it!

did not track it, did it all on luck, did not work out (needed refuel mission)

- Any additional note or description?

will be told under the right places

Used crafts (for comparing purposes):

http://imgur.com/a/6oX6n#0

Assembly:

Launch of the Mothership, called Big Poppa:

http://imgur.com/a/pnHYF#0

Refuel launches:

http://imgur.com/a/5Afse#0

Final Edits (Extra fuel tanks, crew and extra re-entry pod):

http://imgur.com/a/TKMMh#0

Mission:

Now we have arrived at the actual mission

Kerbin to Jool transfer:

http://imgur.com/a/JEsFN#0

Tylo:

From Jool Orbit I first wanted to do Tylo as that lander was the heaviest.

I have a note about Tylo: After I arrived in Tylo orbit I stopped my play session, however between this session and the next one I played around in another save to test some new ideas (not even related). For this I installed Hyper edit as I did not want to spend too much time as I wanted that time to finish the Jool mission. When I wanted to deinstall Hyperedit I accidently deleted Kerbal Alarm Clock, I found out when I reviewed the screenshots of the session (I stopped after I had rendezvoused) and saw instead of my Kerbal Alarm Clock logo the Hyperedit one. I did not use it for the landing and return and deleted it immidiately after I found out. Luckily there are a lot of screenshots, but if you don't trust it I will post the craft file (I don't know how to do that yet, so then I will have to research it).

http://imgur.com/a/QHh6t#0

Laythe:

After Tylo I wanted to do Laythe as then I could get rid of the SSTO

http://imgur.com/a/PcbeZ#0

Vall:

Next on the list is Vall as I didn't need the droptanks for Bop and Pol, but still used the same lander.

http://imgur.com/a/knxWy#0

Pol:

Next was Pol instead of Bop as Pol was in an easier orbit, and I was getting nervous about my left fuel

http://imgur.com/a/40jV7#0

Bop:

I then went to Bop and surprisingly had enough fuel to do it and even return to Jool orbit.

http://imgur.com/a/4R1nc#0

Refuel Mission:

Then after trying to return to Kerbin I found out I did not have enough dV left, so I included a refueling mission.

http://imgur.com/a/getnI#0

Jool to Kerbin transfer and reentry:

http://imgur.com/a/twWHM#0

That's it, I was quite happy about this achievement as it was the first real big mission I pulled of. The previous biggest one was landing on Duna and Ike in one mission .

Feedback/ rep will be appriciated

Edited July 9, 2015 by nigelvn

Well done!

Regardless of design or approach the Jool challenge it a lot go work and effort - nice!

I've not attempted it myself yet, but have built a few crafts - your's are quite a build!
Sweet ship! I fancy your catamaran design
What LiWhiskers said, I love the dual hull design of your ship! I don't see that too often.
My only question is how did you do the pitch dark landings with no landing lights?

Thanks all!

My only question is how did you do the pitch dark landings with no landing lights?

As you can see I only landed on the dark side of Bop and Pol, which have the lowest gravity. Furthermore was the lander a bit overdesigned for those moons (as it also had to land/return from Vall) which allowed me to be less efficient with my fuel which in turn allowed me to manouvre a bit (this happened on Pol, I only saw on the last moment I landed on a slope, after which I had to burn to a flat area). Moreover I don't know for how long you played KSP, but after my 1000 hours I developed a sense of when to burn while landing in the dark

I do agree that lights would have been fancier, but with the ridiculous part count of the mothership I did not want to try.

Edited July 23, 2015 by nigelvn
